item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Google's TOS doesn't eliminate a user's Fourth Amendment rights, judge rules [pdf] (115 points | 69 comments)
2. Australia/Lord_Howe is the weirdest timezone (864 points | 351 comments)
3. AI Flame Graphs (31 points | 33 comments)
4. Pushing the frontiers of audio generation (118 points | 51 comments)
5. M4 MacBook Pro (512 points | 622 comments)
6. Show HN: LlamaPReview – AI GitHub PR reviewer that learns your codebase (51 points | 22 comments)
7. BYD quarterly sales beat Tesla for first time (48 points | 31 comments)
8. CFPB finalizes personal financial data rights rule (90 points | 28 comments)
9. SimpleQA (20 points | discuss)
10. Launch HN: FlyCode (YC S22) – Stop losing revenue due to failed payments (54 points | 43 comments)
11. Representing web applications as knowledge graphs (37 points | 3 comments)

13. Infisical (YC W23) is hiring full stack engineers (remote or in SF) ( | hide)
14. Show HN: AI OmniGen – AI Image Generator with Consistent Visuals (29 points | 7 comments)

17. Rubocop-obsession: RuboCop extension focused on higher-level concepts (4 points | discuss)
18. Sketchy financials send Supermicro auditors running for the hills (30 points | discuss)
19. Steam games will need to disclose kernel-level anti-cheat on store pages (20 points | 1 comment)
20. Google CEO says more than a quarter of the company's new code is created by AI (100 points | 99 comments)
21. Fruits (2020) (111 points | 21 comments)
22. Benchmarks of Google's Axion Arm-Based CPU (25 points | 5 comments)
23. Crafting Painterly Shaders (17 points | discuss)
24. The unlikely inventor of the automatic rice cooker (8 points | 1 comment)
25. ThunderKittens: Simple, fast, and adorable AI kernels (49 points | 5 comments)
26. NASA reconnected with Voyager 1 after a brief pause (152 points | 102 comments)
27. What scripts have you built to stand up a new server? (7 points | 7 comments)
28. Creating a LLM-as-a-Judge That Drives Business Results (41 points | 3 comments)
29. Thunderbird for Android Now Available (157 points | 63 comments)
30. U.S. military makes first confirmed OpenAI purchase for war-fighting forces (19 points | 3 comments)
